title: IMPACTO Model Purchased Stage Data Model (v0.27)
description: A JSON Schema (v0.27) for expressing purchased-stage information consistent with the IMPACTO Model, supporting AI-assisted roadmap planning. This covers the Purchased Stage (Stage 0) of IMPACTO, with expanded fields to facilitate domain alignment, risk quantification, and next-step recommendations.

stage.description: The purchased stage information for the cybersecurity investment. This is Stage 0 in the IMPACTO Model.

id.description: Numeric identifier for the stage (0 for Purchased Stage).

description.description: A brief description of the stage, indicating that the solution is acquired but not yet operationalized.

MCF.description: Maturity Classification Framework (MCF) captures process maturity and overall readiness at the Purchased Stage.

framework.description: Name of the maturity framework used (e.g., 'CISA Zero Trust Maturity Model v2.0', 'SOC-CMM', etc.).

level.description: The numeric maturity level at the Purchased Stage (this value can vary based on assessment).

levelName.description: A descriptive name for the maturity level (e.g., 'Traditional', 'Initial', 'Managed').

domainMaturity.description: Maturity scores for each IMPACTO domain (Business, People, Process, Technology).

Business.description: Maturity score for the Business domain.

People.description: Maturity score for the People domain.

Process.description: Maturity score for the Process domain.

Technology.description: Maturity score for the Technology domain.

notes.description: Additional commentary on the maturity status and assessment context.

CCF.description: Capability Classification Framework (CCF) documents the technical capabilities available in the purchased solution.

framework.description: Name of the capability framework used (e.g., 'MITRE ATT&CK', 'ENISA', 'Zero Trust pillars', etc.).

utilizationLevel.description: Indicator of how much of the solution's capabilities are being utilized (0 indicates minimal usage).

utilizationDescription.description: A description of the current capability utilization (e.g., 'Default configuration only; advanced features remain uncustomized and inactive').

featureUsage.description: List of key features or capabilities and their usage status.

name.description: Name of the capability or feature.

status.description: Status of the capability (e.g., 'enabled with default settings', 'partially configured', 'not implemented').

notes.description: Additional commentary on the technical capabilities at the Purchased Stage.

PCP.description: Purchased Capability Profile (PCP) detailing the intended features and functionalities expected from the cybersecurity purchase.

capabilitiesPlanned.description: A list of planned capabilities and features intended to be realized.

description.description: Detailed description of what this capability is intended to achieve.

frameworkMapping.description: Mapping of this capability to one or more cybersecurity frameworks or categories.

additionalProperties.description: An array of identifiers or categories from the referenced framework.

objectives.description: The security functions and objectives the solution is expected to fulfill.

notes.description: General notes on the intended capabilities and their alignment with modern zero trust principles.

PRP.description: Purchased Risk Profile (PRP) documenting the expected risk posture and anticipated risk reduction from the purchase.

initialInherentRisk.description: The baseline risk level before implementation (e.g., 'High', 'Critical').

expectedResidualRisk.description: The risk level expected after the solution is operationalized (e.g., 'Medium').

expectedRiskReduction.description: A qualitative or quantitative description of the risk reduction anticipated (e.g., '40-50% reduction').

assumptions.description: Key assumptions regarding integration, staff training, and process formalization.

notes.description: Additional commentary on how the risk profile was derived.

POC.description: Projected Operating Context (POC) detailing the intended environment where the solution will operate.

enterpriseScope.description: The enterprise or business unit scope for the solution (e.g., 'Global Retail Division').

organizationalScope.description: The organizational unit responsible for the solution (e.g., 'Security Operations Center').

functionalScope.description: The specific functions or processes the solution is intended to support (e.g., secure remote access for employees).

architectureAssumptions.description: Assumptions regarding the technical architecture and deployment (e.g., hybrid cloud, on-premises log storage).

notes.description: Comments on how the projected operating context aligns with the overall zero trust strategy.

OI.description: Operational Intelligence (OI) capturing any threat intelligence or insights available at the time of purchase.

threatIntelSources.description: List of threat intelligence sources or feeds considered (often sparse at Stage 0).

incidentLearnings.description: Historical incident insights or lessons that informed the purchase.

feedbackLoopPlanned.description: Indicator whether a feedback mechanism is planned post-purchase.

notes.description: Additional notes on the current state and future plans for operational intelligence.

aiRoadmapPlanning.description: Fields to support AI-assisted roadmap planning, referencing the 'Leveraging JSON Schemas for AI-Assisted Roadmap Planning' section in the IMPACTO Model.

approachUsed.description: Approach used for consolidating domain maturity (e.g., 'lowest-domain', 'weighted-average', 'tiered-threshold', or 'two-step').

nextRecommendedStage.description: The recommended next IMPACTO stage (1-5) for this investment based on domain data.

keyGapsIdentified.description: A list of domain or subdomain areas requiring improvement to advance maturity.

recommendationSummary.description: Textual summary of AI-driven or expert-driven recommendations for improving maturity and capability.

metadata.description: Metadata for the data model, providing context, versioning, and framework alignments.

stageDescription.description: A high-level description of the Purchased Stage.

domains.description: The IMPACTO domains covered by the model (e.g., Business, People, Process, Technology).

frameworkAlignments.description: A list of cybersecurity frameworks or standards that inform the model (e.g., 'SOC-CMM', 'MITRE ATT&CK', 'CISA ZTMM v2.0', 'FAIR').

lastUpdated.description: Date the schema was last updated (e.g., '2025-03-05').

$comment: This JSON Schema (v0.27) extends the previous 0.26 to align more closely with the IMPACTO Model and AI-driven roadmap planning.
